answerText: William (Gerald) Golding[10] William Golding is best known for this novel about a group of boys, including Ralph and Piggy, who run amok when stranded on an island.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Editors 1 | 5 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: He wrote of Wilfred Barclay's attempts to escape his literary biographer in The Paper Men. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this 20th century English author who wrote a "sea trilogy" of novels presented as Edmund Talbot's travel journals from aboard a ship voyage to Australia.
